intro: Gynopleura fasciculata, commonly known as the clustered gynopleura, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered inflorescences and distinctive leaf morphology. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, with five petals and a prominent stamen. Gynopleura fasciculata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
